doc.title: Anna Wintour rails against Silvio Berlusconi
doc.author: Jess Cartner-Morley
doc.description: American Vogue supremo brands Italian leader's government a dictatorship and calls for women to protest at Milan fashion week
doc.tags: Anna Wintour,Silvio Berlusconi,Life and style,World news,Italy,Europe,Milan fashion week autumn/winter 2011,Milan fashion week,Fashion,Media,Fashion weeks

main.p: Anna Wintour shed her usual froideur during an interview in La Repubblica newspaper.
"I have no other words. I am disgusted and embarrassed," she said.
"How can Italy tolerate Silvio Berlusconi and his bevy of girls?"

She described the prime minister's government as "in effect a dictatorship" and contrasted the respected standing of Italian fashion to the way in which Italy's political life has been dragged into disrepute.
She also said she would like to see demonstrations by women against Berlusconi during the fashion shows in Milan.
